comments:
Duplication Instructions:
1.  Create a new BPEL file.
2.  Use the BPEL editor to create a new PartnerLink.
3.  View the properties of the new PartnerLink and click the Browse button to select the partner link type.
4.  On the "Choose Partner Link Type" dialog click the Add WSDL button.
5.  On the import dialog select an external WSDL that DOES NOT contain a partner link type.  Click ok.
6.  Back on the "Choose Partner Link Type" dialog, select the port type from the newly imported WSDL.
7.  Click ok.  Notice nothing happens.  The dialog is still there.  At this point the CreatePartnerLinkWizard should be displayed.

I traced this down to PartnerLinkTypeSelectorDialog.okPressed() (approximately line #184):

wizard.setBPELEditor( ModelHelper.getBPELEditor( pt ) );

ModelHelper.getBPELEditor() is returning null and this results in a
NullPointerException:

java.lang.NullPointerException
    at 
org.eclipse.bpel.ui.wizards.CreatePartnerLinkWizard.addPages(CreatePartnerLi
nkWizard.java:67)
    at 
org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.createContents(WizardDialog.java:499)
    at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.create(Window.java:426)
I have a fix for this to be checked in soon ...
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
